description:
This module defines a function to check if an integrity constraint is satisfied. The integrity constraint needs to be declared in the prolog of a module.

This module is part of Zorba's XQuery Data Definition Facility. All the integrity constraints managed by this module have to be pre-declared in the prolog of a module. Please refer to the general documentation for more information and examples.
authors: <xqdoc:author xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">Nicolae Brinza, Matthias Brantner, David Graf, Till Westmann, Markos Zaharioudakis</xqdoc:author>

functions.name: check-integrity-constraint
functions.description: Checks if the specified constraints are valid in the database.
functions.summary: Checks if the specified constraints are valid in the database.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the integrity constraint to check.

returns.description: true if the constraints are valid; false otherwise.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZDDY0031 if the integrity constraint is not declared.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZDDY0032 if the integrity constraint is not available.</xqdoc:error>
